comments.body: `isAttached` should take the full list of volumes to check instead of issuing a separate `isAttached` call per volume. Since this call can happen frequently, we should avoid fanning out the number of backend calls (to prevent quota issues).
I should probably be called "areAttached" then, too?
Yes, it looks like only the name of the method was changed here: the flex call should be changed from `isAttached` to `areAttached`. @chakri-nelluri please fix that.

Saw your comment:

> I thought about it. The driver side callout implementation will be very tricky if we pass all specs at the same time on the command line. If we have the "unique volume name" passed to the call, we can use it. If not, we have to make another callout to get the "volume name", which is equally costly.
> 
> I agree with cost & quota issues. Any other way to do it?

Processing
I'll let you and @MikaelCluseau decide, if it is too difficult to implement.
